name: The Westin St. Francis San Francisco on Union Square

reviews.title: The most comfy beds in the world!!!
reviews.text: I would not say that this is the best hotel I have ever stayed in but the beds must be amongst the best I have ever slept in, so comfortable. We specifically asked for a room in the tower and that is what we got. The rooms by american standards are average in size but are well furnished and very welcoming. The hotel it's self is in a prime location for visting San Fran. As a first time visitor it had everything required and felt a little special. It is excellent value for money when you compare it to good hotels in other cities around the world. Do yourself a favour stay here in a tower room.

reviews.title: Great Location, Slept SO Well!
reviews.text: I managed to get a great rate of $75/night on priceline for my three night stay at the Westin St. Francis.
The location cannot be beat, right on Union Square and great for shopping. I was given a "12% off for a day" Macy's voucher with my check in key, which came in handy for the sales.
reviews.title: CANT BELIEVE THIS IS A WESTIN,hotel needs to be retired
Over-rated, underperforming, disappointing
reviews.text: Entering the hotel, there is a sense of the European Grand Hotel, with plenty of marble and brass furnishings, however a modernisation of the lobby gives a contemporary feel and there are plenty of places to meet with friends or colleagues.

reviews.title: Solid. No complaints.
reviews.text: On check in, the agent asked if I was a priceline or expedia customer. He was courteous, though not overly friendly (did not ask how I was etc.). I confirmed I was a priceline customer, and asked if that affected the room I received. He said only "standard" rooms in the older part of the building were allocated for priceline guests. Check in took about 10 minutes as his computer broke down, though he apologised for this delay.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Reviewer: from Melbourne Australia
reviews.title: Great place to stay

likes.disliked: — the driveway at the front-was congested at times

reviews.text: We checked in here for a 5 day stay over New Year. The staff at check in were wonderful when we checked in late after plane delays. We had asked for an upgrade and we were upgraded to a room on a higher floor without a problem. During our time there the staff were always friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Great Hotel - Lives up to the Westin Name

likes.disliked: — Charges for Parking (High) and Lack of Free Internet

reviews.title: Doesn't live up to the hype
reviews.text: The room was very clean. The bed was extremely comfortable and we slept very well. We did not use the mini bar as the cost was expensive. The fridge had a sensor so we were worried about even opening the fridge! The bathroom was a little small for a hotel of this rating but we made do.
The location is great-right near Union Square but within walking distance of the Bay-via Market Street. We walked everywhere even down to Fisherman's Wharf.
reviews.title: AWFUL!!!

reviews.text: We had booked this with a package that included tours and airport transfers and we were very happy with the cost. We did not feel that the hotel was overly expensive. We would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Great location for a SF holiday!
Great Holiday Spot
reviews.text: What a great spot for the holidays. Great restaurants and shopping are all just a short walk from the hotel.

reviews.title: Not worth it!
reviews.text: The room was nice but I did see some things that turned me off. For example: Stains on the curtains in the room and Hallways in desperate need of renovations.
Some areas definitely need updating, but others are just great because they show the character of the hotel.
reviews.title: Solid, but not as great as most Westins

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Pros: Fast Check In, Perfect Location, great holiday abience, never let down by the Westin Beds.
reviews.title: St. Francis -- Loved it, hated it (smile)

likes.liked: — Its central location, and the historical connections.
likes.disliked: — The crowds of people (due mainly to Christmas shopping).

reviews.text: Cons: Outdated areas, Long Lines at the elevators, extremely long wait times for valet.
reviews.title: We had a great experience

likes.liked: — The front desk and the room

reviews.text: Oh my god, when i read the review from the pilots wife a few before mine it was like our experience all over again. I had come from England and spent 3 days in Las Vegas and then planned a 3 day trip to SF at the W S Francis, i had been planning the trip for nearly 6 months. We were tired on arrival having a 6am check in at the airport, when i arrived into our upgraded deluxe room with a view i actually did burst into tears, we had a view of the car park across the street!!!!!!! My husband went to reception to ask to be moved which we were, to a room overlooking the square, the one and only good thing about this room. it Staank!!!!!!!!!! We had an Ozone machine brought up, sprayed the room with perfume and left all the windows wide open. The room had obviously had smokers in, everything stank of smoke and a fusty old smell like an old peoples home, it did not get any better. Someone had removed the fire alarm from the ceiling. Bathroom was grimy and had mildew growing up the walls, the bath was anything other than heavenly!!! Bed apart from being smelly was OK but couldnt enjoy our stay at all, overall save your money and go somewhere more modern, and clean, this place spoiled our whole trip to SF and we couldnt wait to get back to Vegas YUK YUK YUK
reviews.title: Well below par

reviews.text: The St. Francis was our teenagers choice. They loved all the action in the lobby and in Union Square.We were able to get a last minute room for under $150.00. The room in the newer part of the hotel was quite nice. It was more spacious than other San Francisco 4 star hotels in S.F. The only negative was the shower lever falling off in my hand. The room was very clean and quiet.
reviews.title: Enjoyed Our Stay
Not the best of Westin
reviews.text: I was a little disappointed that they did not have umbrellas to use in the rain storm, as many hotels do in S.F. The staff apologized and sent us to Walgreens down the street.

reviews.title: GREAT!
reviews.text: Overall we enjoyed our stay and for that price we will stay there again.

reviews.title: Good location, ok accomodations
reviews.text: We stayed here four nights, including Christmas. The lobby and location of the hotel are fantastic. You are right in Union Square and just blocks from MUNI and the F Cars. Our room was in the newer tower on the 18th floor. It was an average room, not too large. The bed was the usual Heavenly bed and very comfortable, but outside of that, a rather average room. The parking was $44 a day, but compared to surrounding garages, that was actually the cheapest! We didn't eat in any of the restaurants, but Sears' Fine Dining and Lefty O'Douls just outside of the hotel both had good breakfasts. Overall, not the usual Westin experience I've had in the past, especially as a Starwood member.

reviews.title: Great location, but unimpressed
reviews.text: We chose to stay at the Westin because we like other Westin hotels, the location was right and we were attracted to the history of the hotel. But ... the construction inside made the hotel unappealling, the air conditioning in our room was weak, the water pressure made the heavenly shower somewhat unheavenly, and the iron must of cost a couple of bucks. We returned to our room at 2:30pm after leaving early in the morning to find the room was still not yet made. Disappointing. After that, the maid knocked every 30 minutes to get into our room to clean after we explained to her we needed 90 minutes to shower and change. Overall, the employees were hospitable, but the services were disappointing. I will stay in Westins in the future, but not this one.

reviews.title: Bad Room Experience
reviews.text: (Also note, for this hotel - the beds are heavenly - but in many rooms they are double. Be sure to pay for a room with queen and/or a view if it's important to you.)

reviews.title: Lovely Hotel
reviews.text: We booked in the Westin St. Francis for an adult long weekend last summer. We were expecting a huge dose of class and charm but instead fourd ourselves going to the front desk three times to fix things. Our first room looked onto a brick wall with a bathroom the size of a small closet. The best thing about it was the bed but we couldn't see ourselves spending four days in a viewless room. The front desk moved us into a different room (after we paid an upgrade fee) but it was right across from the elevator. Our third room was in the Tower. We moved our stuff and left to spend the day touring. When we returned we were sitting in our room and heard this terrible mechanical groan. Turned out we were in a handicap room that was located next to the elevator shaft. We were appalled that these were the rooms they put people with handicaps. Do they think that they don't deserve better? We were once again moved back to the old part of the hotel into a room with a view of the street - at least we had some natural light. The concession here was we were now in a double bed. We chalked it up at this point and decided if we went back again we'd end up with a single bed! We thought we were going to be in a classic, comfy room and ended up disappointed. We'll not go back and recommend to others that they look elsewhere for true San Francisco charm.

reviews.title: We loved it!!
reviews.text: Stayed 21st-24th May. Hotel is beautiful. We had a room in the Tower 21st Floor. The room was where I had requested - high floor in Tower but the only thing was it had no view. It did not matter as the room was lovely. Very comfy beds, spacious room, nice bathroom so what else do you want when visiting somewhere as you don't sit in the room looking out of the window. It is a classy hotel with prices to match but it is not stuffy. There were the suits but also the casual look everywhere. It is right in Union Square which is where I would recommend any first timers to San Francisco to stay. We have stayed in another hotel a short distance from this and although equally comfortable it was on the edge of an unsavoury area so had to be careful which direction you walked. In WSF it looked as though there were renovations to an area/bar? going on in area near entrance. Would stay there again if visiting.

reviews.title: Average, (ignore the hype)
reviews.text: First trip to SF over Memorial Day weekend - we loved the St Francis and San Francisco!!

This hotel was an extreme let down. There is a lot of hype about the St. Francis due to its' historical value in San Francisco, however, this is an example of when preservation goes too far. Aside from the dirty room, with lifted carpet, chains hanging on the wall for no reason, outdated furniture clearly not original to the hotel and damage to the walls and doors, this hotel was most dissapointing because of the horrible service. It took over 30 minutes for the staff to come to my room to help me with my bags despite my current disability and 20 minutes on hold with valet and another 20 minutes waiting for the car after I was told to come down to give them my claim ticket. Further, the staff would not even make change for my wife when we needed to break a $20 for tips for the staff (however this proved to be unnecessary as the staff was not deserving of tips anyway). Additionally, housekeeping came around 8:30 a.m. to clean the room I asked her not to come in as we were not awake and ready yet, after which she continued to come every 30 minutes even though we were checking out at 11:30 a.m. I have stayed at better Double Trees and will definitely stay at Le Meridien or Hotel Nikko for my future San Francisco trips.
reviews.title: Horrible service at the St. Francis

likes.liked: — The fact that it was in Union Square - Definitely not unique to this hotel

reviews.title: Do not stay in the Historic wing
reviews.text: First the Good:
Great location.
reviews.title: Boo for the Westin St. Francis

reviews.text: Friendly staff.
reviews.title: NOT a 4 or 5 star hotel

reviews.text: Comfortable Beds.
reviews.title: An Old Classic

likes.disliked: — Cost was high for value received, service was average

reviews.title: Great Location
reviews.text: Booked through Expedia. Stayed for 7 nights. Minor problem with my son's name being on reservation. Got a great rate for 2 rooms. Staff was very friendly and the location in Union Square was perfect. can go just about anywher in San Francisco from the front door of the hotel. Stayed in older part of hotel but rooms were clean and very well kept. Rooms had older architectral syle with chandelier and lots of moldings. Bed was very comfortable ( 6'4" here) Room service and bar much too pricey. You can get a lot less expensive meals elswhere. Max's restaurent next door is excellent for breakfast ( 3 eggs, 3 sausage, 1 biscuit and juice for $8. Get City Pass it is bargain at $30 for 7 days. You can ride any pub transportation, including the Trollys, for 7 days as many times as you like. Love San Francisco

Last month we went to San francisco for a short vacation. The hotel we stayed at was the Westin St Francis. The room was great, the service , first class. And the location was central to getting around the city to go sightseeing. We will be staying again, at this hotel on our next trip to San francisco.
reviews.title: Great Hotel
Not bad, but tried to rip us off
reviews.text: We reserved this hotel for a last minute one night stay through the westin web site. According to the web site, we reserved a king, non-smoking. However, when we go to the hotel, they claimed to not have any kings on a non-smoking floor. They offered a queen. We went to look at it, and it was a double! The same double I could have booked for $30 less on the web site. We called down to reception, and asked to see the king, smoking. It didn't smell bad, so we took it. However, the hotel was far less than accomodating! The bed and shower were "heavenly," but the service was far from it.

reviews.title: Close to Shopping but Area Unsafe
reviews.text: The Westin is an above-average hotel with some rooms overlooking Union Square. There is good shopping nearby but the area is overrun by aggressive homeless people, especially at night.

reviews.title: A true Classic!
reviews.text: The stores near the hotel include Macys, Macy's Men's Store (a separate department store), Saks Fifth Avenue, Saks Fifth Avenue Men's store (a smaller, separate department store), and Nieman-Marcus. The American Conservatory Theater is across the street from the hotel. A cable car runs up Powell street at the front of the hotel. If you walk down three blocks to Powell and Market Streets, you can see the cable car being turned around.

My company hosted a conference at the hotel, so I stayed a couple of nights there. The stay was excellent. This is a lovely old historic hotel with great architectural details throughout. The staff was incredibly gracious and helpful. We had a large group there for our conference and everyone from the staff at reception to the staff who brought the afternoon coffee service were great. Very well-run from top to bottom.
reviews.title: Excellent stay

reviews.text: My room was one of the smaller ones, but everything was nice and had a nice layout. The bed was one of the most comfortable hotel beds I have slept in.
reviews.title: Quite Sub-Par

reviews.text: Of course parking is seriously pricey, but that is par for the course at downtown hotels in SF. There are other garages in the area that aren't as pricey, so if you are bringing a car, investigate the parking options and save some money. And yes, internet is stupidly expensive in the hotel - this is one of my pet peeves about the hotel industry in general - the nicer the hotel, the more they charge for things like Wi-Fi. Aunt Mabel's Country Motel will have complimentary Wi-Fi, but a hotel the caliber of the Westin St. Francis charges guests a bunch for Wi-Fi.
reviews.title: Classic hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I've stayed in several four star hotels in San Francisco and relatively speaking, this was a great disappointment. The beds were very soft and uncomfortable, our shower had several weeks worth of pink and black mold growing in it, the bathroom floor hadn't been swept, the bathroom mirror and wall behind the sink were dirty with body fluids, and the walls and molding in the room were dented and full of scuff marks. There were charges for everything including almost $15 a day to use the internet, a charge to empty the refrigerator, charges for local calls, a parking fee that is twice the cost of the garage across the street, and an unresponsive front desk. I definitely wouldn't stay here again.
reviews.title: Excellent Staff and Location

reviews.text: The service at this hotel was very good, friendly help to find the right shops and things like that. The room was really expensive but perhaps it is like that in central San Francisco. The room was fine but very small but that is perhaps due to the fact that it is a really old hotel. I ate at the restaurant at the back of the hotel one night. It was a little old fashioned, perhaps fitting style in this hotel. The food was good and the atmosphere was very peaceful. The only real complaint would be that they didn’t offer free Wi-Fi in the room.
reviews.title: Time to renovate
Overpriced, dirty rooms and windows
reviews.text: A very large property, modern design rooms but little details missing, had to ask for Bell captain to open mini bar as reception did not provide key, or map of local area or any info on hotel. Dirty mirrors and windows. I prefered The Palalce and the Rex

This is a beautiful hotel in a super location, but the service and attitude of the staff is so abysmal that it negates the positive features of this hotel. We booked a room in the Tower. After checking in and arriving at the room, we opened the door only to find it was already occupied! We went back downstairs to inform the front desk - no apology, no "sorry for the inconvenience" (not to mention the shock it caused us). Room #2 had so little water pressure that it was impossible to even wash your hair. Back downstairs again - no apology again, just a 30 minute wait for another room. Granted, these rooms were all nice enough, but by the time we finally settled in room #3, their allure was hard to appreciate.
reviews.title: Terrible service, many better places to stay
Tired
reviews.text: I witnessed similarly bad service and attitude inflicted on other guests, so no need to take it personally.
Don't stay here. You can do much better in San Francisco.
reviews.title: The Westin St Francis does not live up to it's reputation

reviews.text: I guess for the price and location this place isn't too bad, but this is far and away the worst Westin I've ever stayed in. time for a major room and common area overhaul. They do have some sort of hipster lobby bar/restaurant thing going on but in a city full of that sort of thing it doesn't do much to make up for the overall tiredness that the rest of the hotel conveys. Even with some decent Starwood status your "upgrade" upon check-in just gets you a slightly bigger room in desperate need of a renovation. Stay there if you want to be right on Union Square, really want the Starwood points, and are on a budget but otherwise there's better to be had.
reviews.title: Time to renovate the rooms!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed 1 night in the historic portion of the hotel. Though I ahd booked a standard room, I was not told that the room had a full-sized bed and a shower. I changed to another interior room that had a queen-sized bed but the room's condition was the same as the first one: scratched, old furniture, out-dated carpet, and furniture that had seen far better days. The HVAC wasn't working well and we spent a stuffy night - fresh air was out since the one window overlooked the interior light well. The bathroom was clean and well outfitted, in stark contrast to the rest of the room. What was perhaps the most ironic part of the whole experience was that there was a flat screen HDTV in a room full of furniture and decor that was desperate to be updated. It was the first time I ever equated the terms "dump" and "Westin." I do hear good things about the tower rooms; my thinking is that they neglected to provide the interior customers the same quality experience other customers may receive whilst at the hotel. So unfortunate.
reviews.title: Beware interior rooms in historic portion of the hotel

reviews.text: Without Priceline, this hotel would have been overpriced. The location was excellent, and the public spaces were very nice. Our room was small, relatively dirty given the price and smelled old and musty. Parking was crazy. Our Ford Edge was called an oversized SUV. Overall, I would look for a smaller, boutique hotel next time in the same area. We traveled with 3 total people and a larger room would have made things more comfortable.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel...But
Enjoyed our stay
reviews.text: The Westin St. Francis is located right off of Union Square, a prime location in San Francisco. There are a lot of restaurants nearby, and you're just a couple blocks away from the Powell Station of the MUNI, which allows you access to many other San Francisco neighborhoods. You're steps away from Chinatown, and you're along a cable car route to take you down to Fisherman's wharf. You just can't beat the location.

My best recommendation would be to request staying in the towers of the hotel. Our first night, my husband and I were assigned to one of the more "traditional" rooms in the older area of the hotel. It was so tiny, there was only a double bed and not even room for a dresser. Because I'm pretty short, the shower was so small and the shower head was nonadjustable, I had to literally stand with my nose against the marble wall to get the water to hit my hair. It must have been the older construction or the high ceilings in our room, but I had a hard time sleeping that first night because our neighbor's pipes shrieked every time they turned on the sink or flushed the toilet.
reviews.title: Very good hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The next morning I called the front desk, and they cheerfully moved us to one of the rooms in the Towers for the remainder of our stay once one became available. This made a world of difference. Our room was three times the size, we had a king bed, dresser, enough floor space to do back flips if we wanted to, and a large and comfortable bathroom. And of course, the room was quiet and free from the noise of our neighbors.
reviews.title: Highly recomended

reviews.text: Hotel was one of the most uncomfortable I have stayed in. Staff very aloof (WHY????) and hotel bar closed at 10.50!
reviews.title: Overated and unfriendly

reviews.text: We are a family of 5 and stayed at the Westin St Francis for 4 ngts from July 15th. I like others was dubious as to how it was going to be having read earlier reviews. However, we couldn't find fault. The check-in staff were extremely helpful and nothing was too much trouble. Initially we had 2 connecting rooms in the old part of the hotel which had a great view of Union Sq however my boys were a bit spooked by the more traditional style of room so I asked if it would be possible to move into the newer tower at the back. My husband and I would happily have stayed where we were but we did move and the new rooms were also just as luxurious. Wherever we went in the hotel everyone was extremely helpful, polite, pleasant and courteous and you feel like you are staying somewhere very special especially with all its history. You are also extremely handy for all the sights and the cablecar stops right outside the front door of the hotel
reviews.title: loved the Westin

reviews.text: We hope to go again sometime as San Francisco had so much to offer and we would definitely stay here again
reviews.title: Great City, Shops and Hotel

reviews.text: We came to stay at the Westin St Francis as the first part of our honeymoon, the plane arrived in San Francisco in dissapointing weather, we expectedSan Fran to be misty but this was a joke... we couldnt see a thing, before we could hail a cab a nice old chap hoisted our luggage into his blacked out Lincoln, we arrived at the beautifull St Francis hotel, walked up to reception and checked in straight away, we got into there superman lifts to the 16th floor to find as though we were in the extended part of the st francis and not the beautifull building we saw at Union square, we walked down the corridor (which can definetely get re-decorated as we were not in the 70s anymore, got tothe room which was an o.k size but what a great size and comfortable bed. Being on the 16th floor was a bonus, just ashame we couldnt see out the disgusting dirty windows. The concierge (Glen) was very very helpfull with sorting out tours and phonecalls for us. After 2 days of exploring the city, the mist vanished and gave us beautifull weather. Recommend city tour, sausalito, muir woods and most of all ALCATRAZ, a great day out!!! all through VIP TOURS. Make sure you pack some jumpers as summer can still be extremely cold and most of all... go and visit the "cheesecake Factory" ontop of Macies in Union Square for food but share your starters and main course as the portions are unbelievably huge (we learned this the hard way). Overall a great time in San Franciscos Westin St Francis.
reviews.title: Great stay with the kids!

reviews.text: We stayed in two connecting rooms the newly renovated tower and could not have asked for better rooms. Our check-in was extremely prompt (via the Starwood Guests line) and though they initially put us into two rooms that did not connect, we remedied the problem very easily through a reprogrammed key. The location is great, the bathrooms luxurious and the beds were fabulous. We'll definitely be back!
reviews.title: Historic and charming, with the right touch of modern

reviews.text: My friends and I needed a hotel in the middle of everything for New Year's eve. I booked this hotel room less than a month before the big day through the hotel's website. The room was a decent size, good amenities, and although they were having a huge party that night (which i wouldn't pay $180 for again), we were able to sleep through the night with little noise when we finally were done partying. I would definitely stay here again. But if you're looking for new year's eve fun, skip the overpriced hotel party with the bad music and wet dancefloor. They must have hired every weddding deejay they could find. The location, however, was fabulous, the bed was awesome, and the price was right for New Year's Eve!
reviews.title: New Year's Eve convenience

reviews.text: Let’s not get issues mixed here; the Westin St. Francis is a wonderful property. The problem is if you think you got a deal guess again!
reviews.title: Hotwire No Deal at St. Francis

likes.liked: — The Room was large and well appointed.

reviews.text: I stayed at the Westin or two day on business. I booked the room through Hotwire as I usually do. The problems started before I even got to the hotel. I called the St. Francis to confirm my reservation a few days prior to my stay. I was told at that point that all hotwire rooms were only the rooms that provided a full bed. There is no way my wife and I would fit in a full bed, so we had to pay $35 a night for the upgrade. I have never had to add money to get a bed we could actually sleep in.
reviews.title: Great Location, Historic Hotel
clean but small
reviews.text: Another detail that was conveniently left out is that the Westin St. Francis charges $51.30 a day for parking. I am used to paying for parking as most hotels now charge you. Even though you are staying at their property, and in most cases there is no other parking options, they charge you for parking. This however, in my honest opinion is a complete rip off!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: So take your great deal at the Westin; $125 a night. Now add the parking and the up charge for a bed large enough for two adults to actually sleep in; another $86.30. I’m not sure you tell me is it a great deal any more at $211.30 a night?
reviews.title: Location, Location!!!
Happy New Year
reviews.text: We booked 2 nights at the Westin St. Francis through Hotwire and because of the heavy rains, we called in to let them know we were running late. They assured us that our room will be ready when we get there, because it is a prepaid reservation. We got there 7pm and they happily gave us a free upgrade, bigger room on a high level. WOW. Moreover, room service gave us a free dish on New Year's Eve! I was concerned that they will treat us differently for booking thru a third party agent, but we were treated very well. Security on New Year's Eve was very well observed. My kids, friends and I will come back every New Year's Eve, because THE PARTY is right at the hotel's doorstep!
PLUS: Heavenly Beds - immensely comfortable, soft and warm. Service calls were taken promptly and they were at your door within minutes!
reviews.title: New Year's dud!
ANOTHER GREAT VISIT
reviews.text: We had an unforgettable stay at the Westin St. Francis. Convenient, luxurious, historic, and heavenly. Staff at this hotel appear to be content, wearing a smile all the time, even joking around with my children.

reviews.title: shifty policies
reviews.text: PS. I read about the review about returning newspapers. I was never charged for them, whether I read them or not.

reviews.title: We loved it.
reviews.text: Our first room smelled bad, actually the whole floor smelled like a convalescent hospital. And, there was paint chipping off the ceiling! After switching rooms, we got something not much better. ( at least it wasn't smelly any more ) The ceiling in the bathroom was moldy and there was someone's hair stuck to the tile around the door which was there during our whole stay. (even though I mentioned it to the front desk - they never got back to me ) The room was extremely small with outdated furnishings & old carpet. We had asked for a king size bed but was told that the old tower didn't have any king size beds in it. We tried to upgrade our room, but was told they didn't have anything else available. Our stay was for 4 nights, but we wanted to go home after the first night as it was very noisy all night long. I guess the walls are really thin. The bathroom had no fan and no counter space. I had to put my personal stuff on the floor. There was a small window that was extremely hard to reach and open. I had to stand on the counter to budge it open. The heater also didn't work and just blew out cold air all night. To top it off, our key stopped working our last night there. Even after a replacement key, we had to keep calling security to open the door for us. I've stayed at westin hotels before and thought they were all very nice with the whole "heavenly" thing.

We spent two nights at the Westin St. Francis over the recent long weekend. I'd been reading some reviews here and noticed many warnings about staying in the old tower. We were graciously met by the parking valet and check in was friendly and efficient. Our rooms, all in the old tower, were tastefully decorated, large and clean, although it does appear as some of the rooms are more up-dated than others. The common areas, hallways included, were spotless and we did not pay for the newspaper left at our doors.
reviews.title: Great Stay
Great, If You Plan Ahead
reviews.text: If there is one complaint, it is the layout of the lobby in the old tower. A previous poster is correct---this is a great and classic San Francisco space and it's a shame that a hotel with so much history has allowed an "of the moment" restaurant to set up shop here. The space just doesn't match the rest of the hotel and during the most of the day, there's more action in the rear part of the lobby (new tower) with a side entrance, than in the main entrance at Union Square.

reviews.title: Huge disappointment
reviews.text: Otherwise, we had a wonderful stay at this San Francisco treasure, the location couldn't be better and we'll definitely be back!!!

reviews.title: At least we got a room in the new tower
reviews.text: This past weekend we spent three days/two nights at the St. Francis. We were assigned this hotel by Priceline and got a good rate (less than $100/night).

reviews.title: Wonderful 8 Nights at Christmas
reviews.text: After reading the reviews on this site, I was fearful of the experience. However, by calling ahead and asking questions about the rooms, we were able to get a double upgrade to a "deluxe" room for $30 extra per night.
Location and Service couldn't be beat. Right on Union Square.
reviews.title: Great Stay at the Westin St. Francis

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I Pricelined and got a bid of $97 in November. Of course that meant that I got the small, older rooms. However, I had no issues with my room. After reading reviews on here, I expected to have a smaller older room. The closet and bathroom were large.
reviews.title: Old Westin, but enjoyable

reviews.text: Perhaps I lucked out, but I had a room that really only adjoined one other room - and I never heard a sound from them. I did hear some rumblings from the hallway, but nothing from above or below.
reviews.title: Great but a litle too pricey

reviews.text: I also heard mention of odors in the old rooms. Not the case for me - they must have found the bottle of Fabreeze before I got there.
reviews.title: I'll NEVER stay there again!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I highly recommend the St. Francis.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel!
Do believe the bad reviews of Westin St Francis !
reviews.text: I was very nervous when the Westin St Francis popped up as the accepted hotel on my Priceline bid due to the consistent poor reviews on this site. Needless to say, the reviews are all quite accurate.

Upon check in , the staff person was pleasant and did upgrade us to a Tower view room which is suppose to have better rooms than the older section. If this is true, then I shudder to think what one would find in those rooms.
reviews.title: Reputation only?
not worth the price
reviews.text: The view was nice and room size very good for San Francisco hotels. However, this is where the good news ends.

The carpet was dirty and is poor condition. Windows dirty. Bathroom dirty with black mold all along the edges. Even the ceiling had spots on it....no ventilation in the bathroom. Water spots on the pictures which looked like they had not been cleaned forever. Only clean thing really was the Heavenly bed which was very comfortable.
reviews.title: Disappointing
Not worth the price
reviews.text: Overall, the lobby is now dark and dreary, again looking as if it needs a deep cleaning as well.

reviews.title: The St. Francis just doesn't care
reviews.text: We stayed for one night. The room was fine for the price (Hotwire $65). We had a small bottle of wine from the mini-bar for $18. It was not bad. When we checked out, I told the desk clerk about the wine and paid $18. When we got home, two $18 charges were on our credit card bill. I called the St. Francis on a Saturday to get their mistake corrected. The desk clerk said there was nothing he could do and said I would have to talk to accounting between 9-5 during the week. He didn't offer to take a message and somehow seemed to suggest that this whole thing was my fault. It's funny how the hotel is able to charge your card 24-7, but when they take your money without cause, suddenly it's very difficult for them to give it back. Very poor attitude and service.

reviews.title: Old, Smelly, Dingy and Creepy
reviews.text: I used Priceline to book a standard room. I put in 4 star hotel and named my price. I used their "name your own price" option and was amazed that I got a standard room at the Westin St. Francis in San Francisco for less than $100. I was really looking forward to staying there, however, when I got to my room I was completely shocked. Right when I got off the elevator the smell in the hallway was terrible. It smelled like an old basement and the lighting was very dim. It is creepy and when I got to my room the smell was even stronger. The room was the size of my closet, the walls had plaster that was coming off and the toilet was old and made a lot of noise when you flushed (the kind of noise that wakes you up when someone upstairs flushes - which happened to us). We ended up not upgrading the room (costs started adding up when you factor in the $45 charge for parking overnight at the hotel) and slept there for that night, but I felt I was suffocating from the smell. The bed was a queen size bed, not the king size I've gotten in other hotels in the past for that price. I feel that Priceline was not honest in that they should have put this room as a 1-star room. It is the worst hotel room I have stayed in ever. I have stayed in better rooms in motels. I would not recommend this to anyone.
I managed to get a fantastic deal on this hotel from Hotwire - it was $75 without taxes. So of course I was thrilled at getting a 4 star hotel right on the doorstep of Union Square for that price.
reviews.title: Great value for money!!

reviews.text: As expected, the parking was exorbitant - but I figured, for the convenience, why not? It was $44+tax. However, when I was checking in at the coutner, I found out that the car parking rates start again every day at 1pm, so even if you arrive at midnight, you will be charged for a 2nd day if you park beyond 1pm the next day. I was annoyed at that so asked for my car to be returned to me. The valets did so without a fuss and even suggested other garages for me to go to. I ended up at the Union Square garage (right below Union Square, entrance opposite Macy's), which is $30 (tax included) for a proper 24 hour block. And plus, it's only a 2 minute walk from the hotel.
reviews.title: The St. Francis is getting better

reviews.text: The room, although not huge, was sufficient for my husband and I. The bed was incredible (as expected) and the shower powerful and great for sore walking muscles.
reviews.title: Great location, okay room...

reviews.text: We spent 3 nights at the St Francis and were a bit disappointed. There is no bar area as such other than some seats in the middle of floor right in front of the main door leading to Union Square. The bar and restaurants are my biggest complaint as the restaurants are very expensive as is the bar. One glass of wine cost $10 and a beer $8 from the bar and there is no privacy to enjoy your drinks whatsoever due to the amount of people entering/leaving the hotel. Good location for shopping though and catching a tram (if you can get on one). Our room was lovely and very big although had no view as it looked straight on to the new wing. Air conditioning also did not function so the room was very stuffy at night.
reviews.title: Average Stay
dim and dismal
reviews.text: Well, where to start. On arrival the hotel is in a great location and has a grand opening. Thats about all the good stuff. We stayed there as part of our honeymoon and were very disappointed. First of all the room smelt of urine and was very musty. The room itself was dimly lit and looked out onto brick wall. The 'heavenly' bath was no heavenly bath. It was half the length of a normal one. The staff were not very friendly and when we finally checked out I was presented with a bill for 5 attempted local calls, where i had not even got through. (they did however delete the charges) Also

reviews.title: Don't bother
reviews.text: The bar in the foyer had changed to a minimalistic restaurant bar which was closed for a private function on the first night we were there.

reviews.title: Nice but a little too stiff
reviews.text: Other than that, it was fine! San Fransisco was great, riding the cable car to fishermans wharf and the ferry to sausalito was a great day also.

reviews.title: Heavenly Bed - Bad Streets
reviews.text: If I was going again, I would recommend 2 things, first stop in a different hotel, there are plenty of nice looking hotels, and secondly book alcatraz in advance as they are fully booked up most of the time.
We didnt stay here but did a sight inspection as part of work (I am a travel agent).
reviews.title: One of the best....

reviews.text: Located once again in the heart of Union Square this hotel would be one of the nicest in San Francisco. This hotel was built in 1904 and was burnt down in 1906. It was rebuilt in 1909 and is now a historic, luxury building.
reviews.title: Showing it's age despite the great location!

likes.disliked: — Aged Product with inferior rooms that need revamping!

reviews.text: The rooms are of a medium size and all feature the trademark ‘Westin Heavenly Beds’. The hotel offers its own arcade of shops in the lower level, and a 5 star dining restaurant – Michael Mina. Michael Mina is a 3 hour dining experience not to be missed.
reviews.title: A beautiful hotel in an amazing city

reviews.text: I stayed here during late Nov on mix of Business and Pleasure from the UK. The access from the street is muddled as there is the Union Square access (pass Victoria Secrets) or from the Garage/car offload ramp which can be busy at most times.
reviews.title: Great location for some holiday fun in SF!

likes.liked: — Location and the hotel's charming history
likes.disliked: — Older rooms were a little small, but nothing too bad

reviews.text: However once inside the check-in was fairly smooth but reputation in my view is of an hotel that is 'past it's best' and has lived on it past glories to much. The room I had was close to the lift and not away from the lift as requested in my Starwood account, I asked to be moved but was told that there was nothing else available. The bed was comfortable but took up almost 70% of the room space, there was only a small window and overall the furnishings and decor was poor and needed a much needed makeover. There was no tea/coffee make in my roomand I had to request it, also I requested my own refridgerator as the minibar costs are prohibitive. The Bathroom was small and tolietries were poor in comparsion with other Westins in the US and Europe.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.text: Well the room was great. I stayed in the tower on an upper floor. The bed is one of the most comfortable I have slept in all my life! The view was incrediable. I sat in front of the window, drinking a beer, and taking it all in. BUT... this is where it starts. That beer which I got from the mini bar was $12! Everything is obscenely over priced here. $27.50 for an average martini in the hotel bar, $15 for an hors derve tray, that was nothing more than crackers and cheese. $50 for the breakfast buffet! Thats just plain insulting to your guests. It seems like the St. Francis is one big clip joint. Even the wealthy guests told me, they felt taken advantage of. The staff, was very unfriendly, and I was shocked that professional service people could act this way. I will not stay here again. The bed and view, were not worth it.
reviews.title: Great, BUT......

reviews.text: I stayed at the St. Francis three nights while at a conference. It is a wonderful old building right on Union Square. I had a room in the old section and it was small but well-appointed. My complaints relate to the slowness of service at the front desk, a $2 charge for even local calls and the lack of any lounge area that was free. The hotel is squeezing nickels and dimes out of patrons and that leaves a bad taste. Next time, I will look elsewhere.
reviews.title: Great building and location, but...

reviews.text: This is a beautiful hotel with great potential. But sadly, it does not meet that potential. My business booked more than 10 hotel rooms in addition to a large meeting room as part of a large convention. There was a last minute change; one of my co-workers couldn't go so I went in her place. We lost our deposit on that room. We still used the room!!! But because it was a name change we lost our deposit.
reviews.title: Does Not Meet Its Potential

reviews.text: Terrible customer service.
reviews.title: A business hotel, agencies book you single rooms
Wonderful Stay
reviews.text: As soon as we walked into the lobby, there was an old man telling everyone that they would not be able to check in the rooms. But when we got to the counter, they told us to disregard the crazy old man and we were able to check in. Where is management? Terrible first impression.

We stayed during peak season, so prices were high. We were in the historic side of the hotel and loved the old fashioned paneling and antiques. The Union Square location was nice -- very convenient to all parts of the city, although it was rather congested. We did not need a car but expect to spend a lot on taxis or transit if you don't get one. Cable cars are fun but pricey ($6 per person).
reviews.title: Nice Place, High Prices

reviews.text: The hotel itself was more geared towards professionals and couples than families, but it worked great for our five people (we had adjoining rooms). Maid service was good and friendly; there was some confusion over the availability of our room the first day and the line at the front was a bit slow but otherwise service was good.
reviews.title: Mixed feelings
A lot of good and a lot to watch out for
reviews.text: Concierge service was very helpful (even before we arrived). We did not do much shopping, but if you did this would be ground zero. Everything you could want is nearby. If you want to save on food, visit one of the Walgreens nearby and stock up on produce, etc. Food in and outside the hotel is expensive, but a trip up the street to Sears for breakfast is a must do.
The exercise room was very good and spacious. Bellmen were also gracious and very helpful.
reviews.title: Great Customer Service

reviews.text: Our family stayed at the Westin St. Francis in June 2013. If you're looking for a central location, close to public transit and right on Union Square then this is the place you want to stay. We asked to stay in the newer tower portion of the hotel and I have to say that "newer" does not mean "new". My biggest issue was with housekeeping - our room had heavy dust on the clock radio and in the bathroom, dirty fingerprints on the light switches and doors and a bathroom in dire need of an upgrade. I addressed the problem with management and they responded promptly. Would I go back? probably not. We found the location too busy....you could barely step outside without being run down by hoards of tourists and panhandlers. But if shopping is your thing then this is the place to stay.
reviews.title: Great location. Lovely hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My first visit to San Francisco was in the mid 1970's and 30 years later it is still one of my favourite cities in the US. Maybe its something to do with the atmosphere - or just riding the cable cars.
reviews.title: Enjoyable stay at a landmark hotel

reviews.text: There are PLENTY of great hotels in San Francisco and there are many great deals to be had as well. We decided on the Westin St Francis for the terminus of our mini Christmas holiday trek from Los Angeles to San Francisco for lots of reasons: the Hertz rental drop off is on the back side of this building and saved us over $100 versus dropping the car off at SFO, we wanted to enjoy some of the Christmas experience around Union Square and it is on the cable car (and near the trolley) lines over to Fisherman's Wharf.
reviews.title: Great Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I won't write much about the hotel itself - its history speaks for itself and it has surely earned its place as a San Francisco landmark. If you don't stay here it would still be worth your while to walk through the lobbies, etc.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel in a great location

likes.liked: — The room was lovely when we got one and location great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent three nights here including Christmas eve. Two of the nights we got by cashing in Starwood points and the third night was paid for (to help replenish the points and keep the program going!).
reviews.title: Great Stay

reviews.text: There is a great resource on the hotel's web site which details just about everything on the hotel including a description of each of the room types. Having this in front of you will greatly aid figuring out what kind of accommodation you may want to book here. At the time of our stay we found the St Francis fact sheet by going to their web site at westinstfrancis.com and clicking on the Hotel Fact Sheet button in the lower left hand side of the home page.
reviews.title: Ranked only # 94 on Trip-advisor for a reason.

likes.disliked: — Tiny room, tired furnishings, poor housekeeping.

reviews.title: Disappointing!
reviews.text: We stayed just one nite (05-10-8) and were very disappointed. Room was okay but nothing special for 5 stars. After first entered our room with the key card we've needed to return to the reception three times (! - personal and via housecall) to re-enter the room again! After 30 minutes there was somebody who meet us at the room's door to let us in! Another strange thing: it seems that the hotel's management needs to earn any cent: on the minibars pricelist they really charged the coffee and tea making! And they charged the gym-usage (okay in Las Vegas it is common practise but as well in SFO?). So, we wouldn't recommend this hotel to friends..
This 100-year-old hotel has a great location and impressive lobby, with nice crown mouldings as one reader pointed out.
reviews.title: Strobe lights...
A right doesn't make up for a wrong
reviews.text: Unfortunately you can't sleep in the lobby. I stay in over 100 nights a year in Starwood hotels around the world and have seen some great Westins. But this is not one of them. As such a frequent guest I was put into a handicap accessible room, which means no separate shower, and strobe lights went off in the room when somebody rang my doorbell. If they treat their best guest this way, imagine what kind of room you'll get.

No water in the room unlike other Westins. And the kicker is, when I called down in the morning to request a local newspaper, I was told "you can buy it downstairs". This is the only Westin in the world that does not give you a copy of newspaper to their Starwood Platinum guest. Truly amazing.
reviews.title: Very disappointed

reviews.text: I used to stay here in the late '80s and early '90s, and was always impressed with the hotel. So I was really looking forward to this return trip in over 10 years. Unfortunately so much has changed. This hotel has past its prime. I quickly cancelled my 6-night stay the following month. I think at the Park Hyatt they understand the value of a returning guest. You can find better options in San Francisco.
reviews.title: This hotel's a charmer

reviews.text: Being a avid historic hotel fan I was quite excited about the prospect of coming here. The bed was the typical uber comfertable Westin bed but to my horror I woke up and noticed what looked like dried blood stains. I told the cleaning woman outside who didn't have much of a reaction. Apart from that the location was great but there seems to be a lack of attention to the finer details of customer service in this hotel. I def won't be going back.
reviews.title: Disgusting sheets

reviews.text: We had a fantastic time in San Francisco, which was only increased by the customer service given by Yaris at reception.I only asked for one request from the hotel reception which Yaris went out of her way to do, and that was would some one decorate the room as a surprise for my wifes 50th birthday. I did supply them with banners, ballons etc. An extra touch of flowers and strawberries was also left in the room and Yaris even went to the trouble of phoning and wishing Karen happy birthday and to check that everything was to our liking.The rooms that we had on the third floor didnt have a view, we didnt asked to be moved as we were site seeing allday, I am sure if we had requested a change of room they would have gone out of their way to assist.
reviews.title: Excellant Service

reviews.text: When I booked this hotel I thought it would be a better hotel with higher standard. The check in procedure took forever and the guy wasn't friendly or attentive at all. The room was quite small although we payed a little bit more to get a better room, the bathroom was dirty and the room smelled funny. Our travel companion changed room three times because that weren't satisfied with the room they got. I asked for some advice from the concierge where to go and what to do but he just seemed totally uninterested in helping out. I am not gonna stay here again, the only good thing was the location and that is why they got a better rating from me.
reviews.title: Average hotel with good location

reviews.text: I took my granddaughter to San Francisco for her 19th Birthday. We stayed at The St Francis in the Historic section of the Hotel on the 9th Floor with an amazing view of Union Square. The room was elegant but simple in decor-with crown moulding and a beautiful crystal chandelier hanging from the ceiling that completed the vintage feel. It was clean and well stocked with comfortable beds and plenty of drawer space. It had a parking garage, was close to shopping, entertainment, and staff was very helpful. It was one of my easiest and most convenient overnights in San Francisco.
reviews.title: St. Francis Hotel

reviews.text: We drove into San Francisco and eventually found the Valet parking. We booked the car in and upon entering the Hotel we were very happy with choice we made , the hotel had a Starbucks in the Lobby and hotel looked amazing.
reviews.title: Perfect Location , Good Hotel , Poor Service

reviews.text: We arrived very tired and jet lagged to find that we had not got interconnecting rooms as requested. The staff seemed very unconcerned about this and we didn't get any apology at all. The rooms were small and dark and there was a lot of noise from the streets outside (get a room higher up to avoid this). Apart from this it was fine. Breakfast was good and the concierge was quite helpful.
reviews.title: Fine

reviews.text: After, again, reviewing/searching info on the net and using Trip Advisor, we were pleasantly surprised to find that the Westin was a very nice hotel in a great location. My past experience had me choosing a 'five star' (not) resort in Jamaica. Our room was huge (corner room with windows on 2 sides) with high ceilings/moldings, a marble bathroom (also huge) and was cheaper than what was quoted to me, very clean and very comfortable. I would recommend this hotel - wish our room in the wine country had been half its size!
reviews.title: Just right for the price
Disappointed with "The Westin St Frances"
reviews.text: We just returned from a beautiful road trip in California. We stayed at the Westin St Francis for a couple of nights. The location of the hotel was great at Union Square. Room was very small for price we were paying each night. The armoire where they had the TV was dirty with dust and the bathroom was not clean. The closet doors were chipped.
Had to call the conciege for assistance in recommending a restaurant for dinner and was put on hold for over 20 minutes. Had to hang up at the end.
reviews.title: Hotel fine, City Great!

reviews.text: My family and I loved San Francisco. We have two boyes 13 and 16. They loved Alktraz and the Fisherman's Wharf. They especially enjoyed the Trollys. I am sure we will return soon, but would not stay at the The Westin St. Francis. Value for the money not there. Big Hotel, service not there for all these guests. Was very disappointed.
reviews.title: Ho-hum
Great location, great time
reviews.text: Stayed here for 4 nights over Easter and had a great time. The hotel staff checked us in early and were very helpful. The concierge managed to get us tickets for the sold out SF Giants game and directed us to a couple of nice restuarants. The hotel lobby bar was a little pricey and the service not great. Overall a very enjoyable stay.

reviews.title: Disappointing
reviews.text: The carpet had a giant gross stain in the middle of the room like someone got killed in there! A bunch of teenagers were staying on the floor and they hung out in the hallway making noise all night and smoking. Even though we had a non-smoking room/floor all the smoke wafted in all night and stunk up the room and all our clothes. We called security SEVERAL times. They said they would come, but never did. The 4th time we called they actually told us YOU go tell them to get out of the hall. Outrageous. I'll never stay there again.

reviews.title: not great but not that bad
reviews.text: i recently stayed here from 4/13/04 to 4/18/04. I booked the hotel thru expedia for $550 for 5 nights, we checked in early (around noon), we upgraded our room for an extra $30 a night to have a king bed in the tower. It was well worth it, even with the upgrade it cost $700 for 5 nights. As for the location it was excellent, street cars running right in front of the building, tons of shopping in the area and the major bus line runs on market st which is only a few blocks away. I was a little disappointed with the bums in the neighborhood, everywhere you walked people were asking for change or a few bucks. We were on the 11th floor and we heard alot of street noise, so you may want a higher floor if you want silence. It was our first visit to san fran, so we had plenty of things to do. fishermans wharf, caught a game at sbc park(previously pac bell), shopping at union square, alcatraz, lombard street, cable cars, haight ashbury district, chinatown, wine tour, sausalito, muir woods, golden gate bridge. if i visit the area again i would like to stay here but may want to try a hotel closer to fishermans wharf but this hotel is located right in the middle of everything.

reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel
reviews.text: I don't know why people have written bad comments on the St. Francis but as far as I'm concerned it is an excellent hotel in a great location. The rooms are large enough to accomodate a family of four and have all the facilities that you would expect. The staff are efficient, helpful and friendly. As for the beggars, in popular cities you always get them hanging about. It's not the job for the hotel but the police to keep them away.

reviews.title: Wrong, Wrong, Wrong
reviews.text: I honestly think the majority of these reviews must have been written by St Francis staff. Isn't it funny that everything in early December gets 5/5? Especially when the hotel is completely run down, the service is non-existent, the building is surrounded by tramps and the only redeeming feature is Westin's Heavenly beds. I'm sorry, but my experience (maybe because I don't work there) was just terrible.

I stayed here on Dec. 11, 2004 for my company Christmas party. I was pleasantly surprised as I had stayed here many years ago and did not have fond memories. I arrived earlier than check-out time (at 1 PM) to do some shopping, and my husband came in later with another work buddy. Being the holidays, the garage was very busy, but I was able to get out of my car within 5 minutes. I decided to try and check in early and it worked!! I got a tower room, which was decorated very nicely - large marble bath, very spacious. The bed was simply wonderful - King sized and so comfy!! On check-in, I was given coupons for 12% off at Macy's and of course I took advantage of it. I was a little disappointed in that the lobby didn't have the huge gingerbread house it had last year. Our Christmas party was on the 12th floor of the old building, great views of Union Square and good service (towards the end of the night, they did clear our glasses away faster than we preferred). We slept in late, and were told if we didn't need a receipt, we didn't need to wait in the check-out line. The garage was very busy, but we had our car in about 10 minutes. I would recommend this place to anyone. Others in our party stayed in the older section of the hotel and they were happy as well.
reviews.title: Excellent Pre-Christmas Visit
Nightmare In Union Square
reviews.text: I was horribly disappointed by the service, the rooms, and the utter chaos at the St. Francis. I am hoping that the nightmare was due to understaffing during the Holidays. I travel often, and this was by far one of my worst experiences.

reviews.title: Wonderful Experience
reviews.text: A brief Summary : Delayed check in. I was forced to wait until after 5pm for a room. When I attempted to check, no one knew why my room was not yet ready. When I called from outside the hotel, I was put on hold. I asked for a manager, there was no manager. When we did get our room, it was a smoking room.. After an hour or so, we were told there was another room.. This room was a part of a larger suite- a small room, no view. (I had payed for and requested a view months earlier..) There were no other choices, so we accepted the closet like room. The heat was broken- they brought in a space heater- an awful smell was present- maintenance had no idea why. The cot had springs sticking out- and showed up hours after requested. The room was noisy, small and not usually rented out..We were short blankets, towels. The staff was over whelmed- many told me that they were short staffed after the strike.Room service ran out of food, valets were late, need I say more... Stay else where..location alone is not worth all the hassels you will be forced to endure.

reviews.title: Its ok
reviews.text: I was reluctant to stay at the Westin St. Francis based on some of the recent negative reviews. I was actually on the lookout for some of the problems described by other guests and frankly couldn't find any. My experience was quite the contrary. I had a fabulous corner room in the historic building on the 7th floor, very large and elegant with a great view of Union Square. My room was not considered a suite yet in most hotels a room (with sitting area) of this size would definitely be classified as a suite. My check in experience was very professional and courteous. All the hotel staff that I encountered were very kind and helpful. For the $189 rate that I paid (booked on Westin.com), I felt that it was an incredible bargain for this location and quality of the hotel.

reviews.title: Great location & view of the city
reviews.text: I've stayed at the St Francis for about 15 nights over the last year.

reviews.title: It was great!!!!!
reviews.text: I love staying in Westin Hotels and this one was no exception. The heavenly bed and bath are to DIE for!! The staff was friendly, lobby is beautiful. You will feel like a million bucks when you stay here. The trolley is right outside your door, you can walk to Macy's and Nordstrom's and all the best shopping. I'm not sure what all the negative reviews are about. I got a great deal here over Memorial Day weekend and cannot wait to go back! Beautiful. : )

I don't know what everyone is complaining about! It sounds like maybe they all had the same lousy room(??) Anyway, I stayed here for one night last month with my best friend and her husband. We had a tower room on one of the top floors, with an absolutely gorgeous view. In fact, the view was so great that instead of going bar hopping that night, we decided to raid the mini-bar and enjoy our room instead.
reviews.title: Can't understand the negative reviews!?!
Great Hotel
reviews.text: The bell hop who brought our luggage was extra friendly and courteous. We told him of our plans to stay in that night and have some drinks - so he shows back up 15 minutes later with a gorgeous, silver ice bucket (not the standard type that everyone gets in their room) filled with mixers and a couple of limes for our drinks. Very impressive!
We ordered Bloody Mary's and room service the next morning - everything was delicious and delivered promptly. Sure it was expensive, but what do you expect? Besides, you only live once.
reviews.title: We Left -- Horrible Front Desk Service. Yuck.

reviews.text: We called the front desk to request a razor - 5 minutes later there's a knock at the door. We were given not one, but two razors, as well as some packets of nice shave gel. It's these little extra touches that we really appreciated.
reviews.title: Great place to stay

reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel for about a week near the holidays, which was our first time. We had previously avoided it because we had read about the lack of service and old decor. I ended up booking at the hotel because of an irresistible last minute online rate, and we were pleasantly surprised.
reviews.title: Not that bad

reviews.text: It's not the newest and shiniest hotel on the block, but it has a wonderful ambience, particularly in the lobby. The other common areas could use updating, but it certainly wasn't as dingy was we had feared. Our room was on one of the highest floors and had a view of the bridge. It was clean, very spacious with a separate seatinig area, and room service was nonobtrusive and attentive.
reviews.title: A good hotel, would stay here again

reviews.text: Valet is expensive but competitive for the area. I would allow extra time for car retrieval at peak times, like checkout at noon.
reviews.title: Cannot believe this is a Westin hotel!

reviews.text: There is a WONDERFUL restaurant in the hotel, which I highly recommend. There is also a comfy bar area in the lobby where you can get drinks and lounge on plush seating.
reviews.title: Service what service?????

reviews.text: Location right on Union Square is perfect.
reviews.title: Nice weekend spent out of the hotel
Wonderful Stay
reviews.text: Spent two nights in a 5th floor corner room in the main (original) part of the hotel. Warm greeting at check-in (even though I was there just before noon) and I was quickly given my room (am a Starwood Preferred member). A few items in the room showed some wear but the amenties were very good, staff was helpful and the room had the Old World charm I prefer in a city property like this. Room service was pricey but good (the signature crab omelette is excellent); health club was well-equipped and attractive. Overall a great, relaxing stay in a historic and classy property.
Thw Westin St. Francis was a BIG disappointment. I am a Starwood Preferred Guest member, and have stayed at at least 10 Westins this year. This was one of the two worst.
reviews.title: Disappointing

reviews.text: First, the bad:
reviews.title: Lovely end to our holiday

reviews.text: 1. The room, in the newer tower section, showed a lot of wear, especially the wood bathroom mirror frame, which was really water-damaged.
reviews.title: San Francisco Gem!

reviews.text: 2. The windows were FILTHY on the outside. A shame, as the view of Nob Hill and Coit Tower was quite beautiful.
reviews.title: Avoid the temptation

reviews.text: Bartenders in Bourbon Steak were very friendly and accommodating. It was a great location. Upon checkout, Joseph with the bell staff assisted us, went above and beyond, and sent us off with a very fond farewell, making us want to return to the Westin St. Francis.
reviews.title: Joseph with the bell staff was amazing.

reviews.text: There are a number of problems at this hotel. There was an unusually long wait for SPG Platinum member checkin. When I checked in I was given the option of receiving points to forego housekeeping on certain days, which I clearly stated I wanted to do. Accordingly, when I went to breakfast the first morning I left my room in a state where I did not want anyone from the hotel to enter (e.g., many valuable strewn around the room, etc.). On returning from breakfast I discovered housekeeping in my room who insisted I show my identification. I said that it was she who was not supposed to be in my room, and I called the hotel service number FIVE TIMES to ask that a manager come to my room to resolve the situation. About 25 minutes have now passed with no manager and as I write this the situation is unresolved with me in the room and the housekeeping person standing guard. Generally, an extremely poorly managed hotel which I would recommend others avoid..
reviews.title: Terrible Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked only the first four nights at the St Francis, to take opportunity of the great location and then decided to stay 3 more nights. We booked the first room in the Towers (2680), which was very worn down and the view from the description was a side view of the city. Room size was good, so is the service ate the hotel, bar and coffee shop. Parking is expensive, but convenient; I just do not understand why internet is not included at such a venue..
reviews.title: Two very different rooms!

reviews.text: When we wanted to book another three nights, reception did not find a room with a Union Square view, so we went upstairs, checked the Westin website and booked it ourselves. The second room was in the old towers (Landmark) and was lovely (1131), refurbished to its old glamour with a spectacular view of the square.
reviews.title: Great hotel, great location, the best concierge service!

reviews.text: I visited this hotel with my family in July, 2013, and had a fantastic time. The room was spacious and very clean, and the housekeeping service was prompt and attentive, and gave personalized service, asking is if there was anything we needed every time we saw them in the hallways. All this is great... But one of the concierge staff, Glen, really saved the day for us. We rented a car through AAA, and when we arrived, the rental car agency said our reservation had been cancelled. None of the agencies in the area had cars. I went to the concierge to ask how we should manage our planned trips to Sausalito, Muir Woods, and Napa. Glen gave us advice on what was reasonable and what was not, and we decided that a car was really going to be necessary. He made one phone call for us, and within 30 minutes, we were hooked up with a brand new mid-size SUV, perfect for our family of 5, from Enterprise. It was cheaper than what we had originally planned through AAA! Our trip was in danger of being a disaster, all through a mistake by AAA, and Glen took care of us in the most professional and courteous way. In short, Glen got it done and saved the rest of our trip!
reviews.title: Fabulous location & views, excellent service
I can't believe it's a 4 star!
reviews.text: Pros:
Location, can't beat being right on Union Square.
reviews.title: Not a typical Westin

aka: The Westin St. Francis Hotel San Francisco
description: More than just a hotel, The Westin St. Francis is a destination where you can unwind and be pampered by attentive, world-class service. As the only hotel located on Union Square, we are celebrated for our historic Magneta Grandfather Clock, a popular gathering place for generations of travelers, as well as our commitment to guest renewal and relaxation. Explore this legendary landmark, which has drawn locals and visitors for more than a century with our distinguished service and through the timeless refrain "Meet me under the clock!" Inside our warm and welcoming San Francisco luxury hotel, marble columns, ornate balconies, and intricate woodwork transport guests back to the elegance of yesteryear. Yet these magnificent appointments are balanced by modern, groundbreaking amenities including the revolutionary Heavenly Bed, our Starwood Preferred Guest rewards program, and employees dedicated to making you feel at home. Book one of our downtown San Francisco hotel rooms and discover the allure of the city's most charismatic and vital setting.
